author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Madras High Court Bench here has restrained School Education Department from insisting that CBSE schools should submit a self declaration form, containing details of the management and infrastructural facilities, in accordance with an amendment made to Rule 12 of Tamil Nadu Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Rules, 2011 on September 18, 2014.

A Division Bench of Justices S. Manikumar and C.T. Selvam passed the interim order on a writ petition filed by CBSE Schools Management Association challenging the validity of the 2014 amendment.

The judges also directed the High Court Registry to transfer the case to the Principal Seat of the High Court in Chennai and tag it along with a similar case pending before the First Division Bench.

Appearing on behalf of the petitioner association, its counsel S. Srinivasa Raghavan said that only State Board, matriculation and Anglo Indian schools were required to submit self declaration forms before September 18, 2014. It was only after the amendment that schools affiliated to Boards other than State Board of School Examinations were also required to submit the forms.

Rule 12 relating to recognition of schools stated that every school should submit a self declaration in Form Iassuring that it was not run for profit by any individual, group or association.

The information required to be disclosed in the self declaration form also included infrastructural and sanitary facilities available in the schools, enrolment status, quantum of fee collected for different classes, particulars of teaching staff, their qualifications, their salary and so on.
title: CBSE schools need not file self declaration forms: HC
